hero.heading: Historic Elegance in the Heart of Rittenhouse Square

introSection.heading: Experience 170 Years of Philadelphia History
introSection.description: Step into an 1854 Greek Revival masterpiece where history meets luxury. Originally built for prominent Philadelphia merchant Richard Spencer, this magnificent residence has hosted suffragettes, Civil War officers, and Gilded Age society.

features.title: Architectural Grandeur
features.description: 14 original marble fireplaces, ornate plasterwork medallions, 12-foot ceilings with crown molding, and Italian marble mantels throughout.

features.title: Modern Luxury Amenities
features.description: Professional chef's kitchen, spa bathrooms, climate control, high-speed Wi-Fi, smart TVs, washer/dryer, and premium linens.

image.alt: Modern chef's kitchen with marble countertops

features.title: Flexible Living Spaces
features.description: Formal dining for 16, two parlors, library/study, breakfast room, private courtyard garden, and multiple seating areas.

features.title: Prime Rittenhouse Location
features.description: Walk to 100+ restaurants, museums, shopping, and parks. Center City convenience with private mansion tranquility.

roomsPreview.heading: Elegant Accommodations
roomsPreview.description: Five distinct suites, each with unique character and modern comfort

reviewsPreview.heading: Guest Experiences
reviewsPreview.description: Over 500 five-star reviews from guests who've made memories here

bookingSection.description: Book your stay at The Rittenhouse Residence and become part of 170 years of history.
